content: अभिगम् {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> {@--1@} To go to, go near to, approach (with <ab>acc.</ab>); एनमभिजग्मुर्महर्षयः <ls>R. 15. 59</ls>; <ls>Ki. 10. 21</ls>; मनुमेकाग्रमासीनमभिगम्य महर्षयः <ls>Ms. 1. 1</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">11. 100.</ls> {@--2@} To follow, go after; अनुरागाद्वने रामं दिष्ट्या त्वमभिगच्छसि <ls>Rām.</ls> {@--3@} To find, meet with (casually or by chance). {@--4@} To cohabit, have sexual intercourse (with man or woman); अभिगंतास्मि भगिनीं मातरं वा तवेति ह <ls>Y. 2. 205</ls>; अभ्यगच्छः पतिं यत्त्वं भजमानं <ls>Mb.</ls> {@--5@} To take to, undertake, betake oneself to. {@--6@} To get, to share in; be subject to; निद्रामभिगतः <ls>Rām.</ls> {@--7@} To conceive, apprehend, understand, comprehend. {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} {@--1@} To cause to go to or approach; take, convey, send; <ls>Dk. 102.</ls> {@--2@} To cause to apprehend; explain, teach.
